description:
Logs from nova are not recorded when using syslog. Neutron logging works fine using the same rsyslog service. I've tried with debug and verbose enabled and disabled.


1) Nova version:
 1:2014.2.2-0ubuntu1~cloud0 on Ubuntu 14.04

2) Relevant log files:
No relevant log files, as that is the problem

3) Reproduction steps:
  a) Set the following in nova.conf 
           logdir=/var/log/nova
  b) Restart nova services
  c) Confirm that logs are created in /var/log/nova
  d) Remove logdir and add the following to nova.conf
          use_syslog=true
          syslog_log_facility=LOG_LOCAL0
  e) Restart nova services
  f) Nova's logs are not showing up in /var/log/syslog
title: nova doesn't log to syslog

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bill-rich

comments.content: Nova is only user of oslo.log, there is nothing in Nova that can be changed for fixing that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sylvain-bauza

comments.content: Sylvain, not sure what you mean there. None of the logs (nova-api, scheduler, conductor, etc) are being sent to syslog. I'm far more concerned about those than oslo.log. I'm removing the invalid assignment.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bill-rich

comments.content: Bill, the logging capabilities are managed by the oslo.log library that Nova is pulling. All the options you showed in the bug desc are related to that package, not coming from internal Nova configuration flags (even if defined in nova.conf)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sylvain-bauza

comments.content: Got it. I understand now. Thanks for the info!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bill-rich

comments.content:
Bill, could you provide more details about your Syslog daemon configuration? AFAICT Syslog logging is working fine for me (using Mirantis Fuel). There are things that have been broken for some Juno versions [1] but I haven't noticed something so invalidating.
